article:
The 'National Framework of Qualifications' (NFQ) is a system used to describe
levels of educational qualifications in Ireland. Responsibility for maintaining
and developing the framework lies with Quality and Qualifications Ireland (QQI).

Launched in 2003, the NFQ was developed by the National Qualifications Authority
of Ireland as a means of comparing training and qualifications between
institutions of education at all levels. It includes primary school, second
level, FETAC, HETAC, Dublin Institute of Technology and university
courses. http://www.nfq.ie/nfq/en/learner.html The framework consists
of 10 levels, ranging from basic certificates to doctoral level. A 'fan diagram'
[http://www.nfq.ie/nfq/en/images/FanDec2006.jpg] is used to illustrate the
progression of the
levels. [http://www.nfq.ie/nfq/en/public_resources/presentation.html
National Framework of Qualifications - Communication Materials ]
categories: Education in the Republic of Ireland
